variant.question: Near the magnetic pole the?

options.text: horizontal component of the Earth's magnetic field is too small to permit the use of a magnetic compass.
angle of dip is maximal whereby a freely suspended compass needle will be almost fully horizontally aligned.

angle of dip is minimal whereby a freely suspended compass needle will be almost fully vertically aligned.

variant.question: The horizontal component of the Earth magnetic field?

options.text: is very small close to the magnetic poles.
is at its minimum at the magnetic Equator.

variant.question: Which statement is correct regarding the magnetic variation?

options.text: The charted values of magnetic variation on Earth normally change annually due to the magnetic pole movement causing numerical values at all locations to increase or decrease.
The charted values of magnetic variation on Earth normally change annually due to a reducing field strength causing numerical values at all locations to decrease.
The charted values of magnetic variation on Earth normally change annually due to an increasing field strength causing numerical values at all locations to increase.
The charted values of magnetic variation on Earth normally change annually due to magnetic pole movement causing numerical values at all locations to increase.

variant.question: Which of the following statements concerning Earth magnetism is completely correct?

options.text: An isogonal is a line which connects places with the same magnetic variation; the aclinic is the line of zero magnetic dip.
An isogonal is a line which connects places with the same magnetic variation; the agonic line is the line of zero magnetic dip.
An isogonal is a line which connects places of equal dip; the aclinic is the line of zero magnetic dip.
An isogonal is a line which connects places with the same magnetic variation; the aclinic connects places with the same magnetic field strength.
